cause.description:
http://www.johntaylorgatto.com/odysseus.htm
"It’s time to admit that public education operates like a planned economy, a bureaucratic system in which everybody’s role is spelled out in advance and there are few incentives for innovation and productivity. It’s no surprise that our school system doesn’t improve; It more resembles the communist economy than our own market economy." — Albert Shanker, president, American Federation of Teachers
1. Individual learning styles must be recognized and supported.
2. Intellectualism must be fostered.
3. Students must be treated like human beings, not prisoners.
cause.mission: Advocate for attention to individual learning styles and combat homogenization and anti-intellectualism in public schools.
cause.name: Reform American Public Education
